title: Chapter 2: Units and measurement
content: Physical quantities and their measurement, Scientific notation, Significant figures

title: Chapter 3: Motion in a Straight Line
content: Distance, displacement, and coordinate systems,Average velocity and average speed,Velocity and speed from graphs

title: Chapter 4: Motion in a Plane
content: Introduction to vectors and two-dimensional motion,Analyzing vectors using trigonometry,Review: Unit vectors

title: Chapter 5: Law of Motion
content: Introduction to forces and free body, Newton's first law, second law and third law, Normal force and contact force

title: Chapter 6: Work, Energy and Power
content: Introduction to work, Kinetic energy, Work-energy theorem, Gravitational potential energy and conservative forces

title: Chapter 7: System of particles and Rotational Motion
content: Centre of mass, Introduction to rotational motion, Angular kinematics, Torque and equilibrium

title: Chapter 8: Gravitation
content: Newton's law of gravitation, Gravitational potential energy at large distances

title: Chapter 9: Mechanical Properties Of Solids
content: Stress, strain, and modulus of elasticity, Shear and bulk stress

title: Chapter 10: Mechanical Properties Of Fluids
content: Density and pressure, Buoyant force and Archimedes' principle,Fluid dynamics, more

title: Chapter 11: Thermal Properties of matter
content: Measurement of temperature and pressure, Specific heat and heat transfer, Modes of heat transfer, more

title: Chapter 12: Thermodynamics
content: Zeroth and first law of thermodynamics, Work from PV graph and internal energy, Thermodynamic processes and Carnot cycle

title: Chapter 13: Kinetic Theory
content: Ideal gas equation, Kinetic molecular theory of gases

title: Chapter 14: Oscillations
content: Introduction to simple harmonic motion, Simple harmonic motion in spring-mass systems, Simple pendulums, more

title: Chapter 15: Waves
content: Introduction to waves, Wave characteristics, Wave interference, more
